english: upright and impartial; fair-minded; Zhongzheng (Chiang Kai-shek’s courtesy name); moderate and proper

etymology.description: 中 ‘balanced/central’ + 正 ‘upright/proper’ = upright, impartial; moderate and proper; also a courtesy-name element (Zhongzheng).
etymology.interpretation: Combines Confucian ideals of balance (中) and correctness (正), conveying fair-minded, moderate conduct. Also serves as Chiang Kai-shek’s courtesy name and appears in related place names.

examples.chinese: 他为人中正，不偏不倚(他為人中正，不偏不倚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wéirén zhōngzhèng, bù piān bù yǐ.

examples.chinese: 他的处事风格中正平和(他的處事風格中正平和)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de chǔshì fēnggé zhōngzhèng pínghé.
examples.english: His way of handling matters is moderate and proper.

examples.chinese: 台北市中正区以蒋中正命名(臺北市中正區以蔣中正命名)。
examples.pinyin: Táiběi Shì Zhōngzhèng Qū yǐ Jiǎng Zhōngzhèng mìngmíng.
examples.english: Taipei’s Zhongzheng District is named after Chiang Kai-shek (Zhongzheng).
